apartment-lease-agreement.metaDescription: Generate a legally sound residential lease agreement in 7 minutes. Our template protects the rights of the landlord and tenant in accordance with Ukrainian law.
apartment-lease-agreement.h1: Create an apartment lease agreement online in 7 minutes (sample, template)
apartment-lease-agreement.description: Form a legally competent residential lease agreement that will reliably protect the rights of both the landlord and the tenant in Ukraine. Our template takes into account all the essential conditions stipulated by the Civil Code: lease term, amount and procedure of payment, rights and obligations of the parties, liability for property damage, conditions for early termination, and the apartment acceptance-transfer act.
whenNeededList: When renting out an apartment, house, or room for a long term.
To formally record agreements and avoid disputes.

faqItems.question: Do I need to register the agreement with a notary?
faqItems.answer: No, for a residential lease agreement concluded for a term of up to 3 years, notarization is not mandatory. However, at the parties' request, it can be done.

faqItems.question: What if I want to make changes to the template?
faqItems.answer: After generation, you can download the document in Word (.docx) format and freely edit it, adding or changing clauses according to your agreements.

power-of-attorney-vehicle.metaTitle: Power of Attorney for Car (Vehicle POA) - Template 2025 | Create Online
power-of-attorney-vehicle.metaDescription: Generate a Power of Attorney for a car (Vehicle POA) in 5 min. For sale, driving, or travel abroad. Notary-ready legal text.
power-of-attorney-vehicle.h1: Power of Attorney for a Vehicle in 5 Minutes (Sample, Template)
power-of-attorney-vehicle.description: Form a legally correct Power of Attorney (POA) to grant authority to another person regarding your vehicle (motor vehicle). This document, also known as a 'Vehicle POA', allows representing interests in the Service Centers of the Ministry ofInternal Affairs, selling the car, undergoing technical inspections, receiving insurance payments, and performing other actions. Our builder helps create both a General Power of Attorney for a vehicle and a document with clearly limited powers, saving you money on lawyer fees.
whenNeededList: When selling a car without the owner's personal presence ('General POA').
For granting the right to drive the vehicle to a family member or another person.
For representing interests in insurance companies (e.g., after an accident) or Service Centers of the MIA.
For driving the car abroad (if the driver is not the owner).
power-of-attorney-vehicle.requiredDocsTitle: Documents required for a Vehicle POA
requiredDocsList: Passport and Tax ID (IPN) of the vehicle owner (Principal).
Passport data and Tax ID of the person you are authorizing (Agent/Representative).
power-of-attorney-vehicle.faqTitle: Frequently Asked Questions about Vehicle POAs

faqItems.question: Is it mandatory to notarize a Power of Attorney for a car?
faqItems.answer: Yes, a POA concerning the right to dispose (sell, gift) or represent interests in state bodies (MIA) requires mandatory notarization.

faqItems.question: What is the difference between a General and a standard POA?
faqItems.answer: 'General' (a common term) grants maximum powers, including the right to sell and delegate (substitution). A standard POA can be limited, e.g., 'driving rights only' or 'representation at the MIA without the right to sell'.

faqItems.question: Can I create a Power of Attorney for a car via the Diia app?
faqItems.answer: As of 2025, the 'Diia' app only allows 'sharing the technical passport' to grant driving rights to a specific person. For sale, re-registration, or travel abroad, a paper-based, notarized POA is required. Our service prepares exactly this type of document.

faqItems.question: What is the 'right of substitution' (peredoruchennia)?
faqItems.answer: This is a right you grant to your representative, allowing them to issue a POA on your behalf to another person. It is useful but also risky. In our builder, you can choose whether to grant this right.

power-of-attorney-property.metaTitle: Power of Attorney for Real Estate (Sale, Management) - Template 2025 | UDocument
power-of-attorney-property.metaDescription: Create a POA to sell, buy, or manage real estate (apartment, house, land). Notary-ready legal text.
power-of-attorney-property.h1: Power of Attorney for Real Estate Sale/Management (Sample, Template)
power-of-attorney-property.description: Grant authority to a trusted person to conduct operations with your real estate. This document (often called a 'General POA for Real Estate') allows them to sell, buy, rent out, represent your interests in state bodies (TsNAP, BTI), and before third parties. The template includes all requirements for notarization and registration in the Unified Register of Powers of Attorney.
whenNeededList: When buying or selling real estate if you cannot be personally present at the transaction.
For managing your real estate (e.g., renting it out) while you are in another city or country.
For collecting necessary documents and certificates for a deal (from BTI, TsNAP, notaries).
To authorize a professional (realtor, lawyer) to represent your interests.
power-of-attorney-property.requiredDocsTitle: What is needed to issue a POA for Real Estate?
requiredDocsList: Passport and Tax ID (IPN) of the owner (Principal).
Passport data and Tax ID of the person you are authorizing (Agent/Representative).
Documents confirming ownership of the real estate (Extract from the register, sale agreement, certificate of inheritance, etc.).
A clear list of powers you are granting.
power-of-attorney-property.faqTitle: Frequently Asked Questions about Real Estate POAs

faqItems.question: Is notarization mandatory for this type of POA?
faqItems.answer: Yes, absolutely. Any POA for the disposal of real estate is subject to mandatory notarization and registration in the Unified Register of Powers of Attorney.

faqItems.question: Can a POA be issued to several people?
faqItems.answer: Yes, you can specify one or more representatives. They can be authorized to act 'jointly' (all together) or 'independently of each other' (each one separately).

faqItems.question: What are the risks of buying or selling property via a POA?
faqItems.answer: The main risk is the possibility of the POA being revoked by the Principal at any time before the deal. For the buyer, there is also a risk that the Principal may be deceased at the time of the transaction, which invalidates the POA. It is recommended to thoroughly check the POA's validity on the day of the deal.

power-of-attorney-documents.metaTitle: Power of Attorney for Representation and Receiving Documents - Template 2025
power-of-attorney-documents.metaDescription: Create a POA for representation in court, TsNAP, banks, or tax authorities. For submitting and receiving documents (e.g., pension) on your behalf.
power-of-attorney-documents.h1: Power of Attorney for Representation/Receiving or Submitting Documents (Sample, Template)
power-of-attorney-documents.description: This General Power of Attorney grants your representative the right to submit and receive documents, sign, and represent your interests in any institutions, enterprises, and organizations. This may include representation in court, tax authorities, TsNAPs, banks, as well as receiving mail, pension, or other payments. You can clearly define the scope of powers in our builder.
whenNeededList: When you need a representative in court, the tax office, or another state body.
For receiving a pension, mail correspondence, or bank payments.
To authorize someone to submit documents on your behalf to any institution (e.g., to apply for subsidies at a TsNAP).
For handling affairs on your behalf when you are busy or far away.
power-of-attorney-documents.requiredDocsTitle: What is needed to issue this POA?
requiredDocsList: Passport and Tax ID (IPN) of the Principal (you).
Passport data and Tax ID of the Representative (whom you trust).
A clear list of institutions and powers (our builder will help you define this).

faqItems.question: Is it necessary to notarize this POA?
faqItems.answer: It depends on the institution. For representation in court, banks, tax authorities, and for any transactions — notarization is mandatory. To receive mail or a pension, certification by a housing office (ZHEK) or a chief physician (if you are in a hospital) may be sufficient.

faqItems.question: Can I revoke the POA?
faqItems.answer: Yes, the Principal can revoke the POA at any time. To do this, you must notify the representative and third parties (e.g., the bank). A notarized POA is revoked through a notary, who will enter the information into the register.

faqItems.question: How does this POA differ from a lawyer's order (advocate's order)?
faqItems.answer: An advocate's order confirms the lawyer's authority to provide legal assistance (e.g., in a criminal case). A POA (even one issued to a lawyer) grants broader civil law powers, such as the right to sign a settlement agreement or receive funds.

consent-to-the-sale-of-real-estate.metaTitle: Spousal Consent for Sale of Property (Apartment) - Template 2025 | UDocument
consent-to-the-sale-of-real-estate.metaDescription: Prepare a notarized spousal consent form (from wife/husband) for the sale of joint property. Mandatory for transactions with property acquired during marriage.
consent-to-the-sale-of-real-estate.h1: Spousal Consent for Sale of Real Estate (Sample, Template)
consent-to-the-sale-of-real-estate.description: For the sale, gift, or mortgage of property that is the joint property of spouses, the written, notarized consent of the other spouse is required. Our service helps prepare the text of such a statement in compliance with the requirements of the Family Code of Ukraine and notarial practice. This is a mandatory document for any sale transaction of property acquired during marriage.
whenNeededList: When selling an apartment, house, or land plot acquired during marriage.
For concluding a mortgage agreement for joint property.
When gifting joint real estate or a valuable vehicle.
For any transactions requiring notarization that involve joint property.
consent-to-the-sale-of-real-estate.requiredDocsTitle: Documents required for notarizing the consent
requiredDocsList: Passport and Tax ID (IPN) of the spouse giving consent.
Information about the real estate object for which consent is given (exact address).
consent-to-the-sale-of-real-estate.faqTitle: Frequently Asked Questions about Spousal Consent

faqItems.question: Is this consent required if the property is registered only in my name?
faqItems.answer: Yes, if the property was acquired by you during a registered marriage (even if you bought it with 'your own' money), it is considered joint property. The consent of the other spouse is mandatory, regardless of who is listed as the owner in the register.

faqItems.question: When is spousal consent NOT required?
faqItems.answer: Consent is not required if the property is your personal private property. For example, you received it as a gift, inherited it, or acquired it before marriage. Consent is also not required if it is stipulated in your prenuptial agreement.

faqItems.question: What to do if one spouse is abroad?
faqItems.answer: He/she can issue such a statement at a consular office of Ukraine abroad or at a foreign notary. In the latter case, the document must be apostilled (or legalized) and translated into Ukrainian.

faqItems.question: Is consent required if we are not married but live together?
faqItems.answer: If you live as a family without registering the marriage (cohabitation), property acquired with joint funds may also be recognized as joint property. The notary will most likely ask for a statement that you are not in a 'de facto marital relationship' or will require your partner's presence.

consent-for-minor-to-travel-abroad.metaTitle: Permission for Child to Travel Abroad - Parental Consent 2025 | UDocument
consent-for-minor-to-travel-abroad.metaDescription: Prepare a notarized consent form for a child under 16 to travel abroad with one parent or a third party (grandmother, coach).
consent-for-minor-to-travel-abroad.h1: Permission for a Child to Travel Abroad (Sample, Template)
consent-for-minor-to-travel-abroad.description: If a minor child (under 16) travels outside Ukraine with one parent or an authorized person (grandmother, coach, teacher), the notarized consent of the other parent (or both) is required. Our service will help prepare the text of the statement for the notary, which will clearly indicate the country(ies) of travel, the time period, and the details of the accompanying person.
whenNeededList: When a child is going on vacation or to a competition abroad with one parent.
If the child is traveling with a grandmother, grandfather, aunt, or other relatives.
For organized trips as part of tourist or sports groups (e.g., with a coach or teacher).
For crossing the border for any purpose, if the child is not accompanied by both parents.
consent-for-minor-to-travel-abroad.requiredDocsTitle: Documents required for notarizing the permission
requiredDocsList: Passport and Tax ID (IPN) of the parent giving permission.
Exact travel dates and destination country(ies).
Passport details of the accompanying person (if not a parent).
consent-for-minor-to-travel-abroad.faqTitle: Frequently Asked Questions about Child Travel

faqItems.question: For what period can such permission be issued?
faqItems.answer: Usually, permission is issued for a specific trip, indicating exact dates and the destination. It may be possible to issue permission for a longer period (e.g., for one year) for multiple trips to a specific country, but this should be agreed with the notary and the border service.

faqItems.question: When is permission for a child to travel NOT required?
faqItems.answer: Permission is not required if the other parent is a foreigner (and this is stated in the birth certificate), is deprived of parental rights, is declared legally incompetent, or is missing. There are also exceptions in case of a court decision determining the child's place of residence with you or if the other parent is in arrears on alimony payments.

faqItems.question: What to do if one parent refuses to give permission?
faqItems.answer: This is a common problem. If an agreement cannot be reached, the issue of the child's temporary travel abroad can be resolved in court by obtaining a relevant court decision.

faqItems.question: Is permission required for a child to travel during martial law?
faqItems.answer: The rules can change. At the beginning of martial law, travel was simplified, but border guards are now increasingly demanding compliance with general rules, including notarized consent. Always check the current information on the State Border Guard Service (DPSU) website before traveling.

We are committed to protecting your privacy and ensuring the security of your personal data in accordance with the Law of Ukraine 'On Personal Data Protection' and generally accepted international standards.

data_collection_list: Personal Identification Information: name, surname, patronymic, email address, phone number, passport details, identification number (RNOKPP), which you provide during registration or document generation.
Data for Documents: any information you enter into forms to create legal documents (e.g., real estate details, information about the parties to an agreement, etc.).
Technical Information: IP address, browser type, operating system, visit data (including URLs), and cookies to improve the service.
privacy_policy.data_usage_text: Your data is used exclusively for the following purposes:
data_usage_list: Providing and Improving Services: to create and manage your account, generate legal documents, provide consultations, and offer technical support.
Communication: to send service notifications, registration confirmations, respond to your inquiries, and inform you about updates to our services.
Security: to protect our platform from fraud and abuse.
Analytics: to analyze service usage for its improvement and optimization (data is used in an anonymous, aggregated form).
privacy_policy.data_commitment_text: We guarantee that your personal data will NOT be sold, rented, or used for any commercial purposes not related to the provision of UDocument services.
privacy_policy.data_protection_text: We implement modern technical and organizational security measures to protect your data from unauthorized access, alteration, disclosure, or destruction. Data is stored on secure servers. We retain your data only as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes for which it was collected, or as required by law.
privacy_policy.user_rights_text: In accordance with the legislation of Ukraine, you have the right to:

Request the correction of inaccurate data or the deletion of your data.

Lodge complaints regarding the processing of your data with the Ukrainian Parliament Commissioner for Human Rights or in court.
